title: Stocks to Watch on December 30: Reliance Infrastructure, JSW Energy, IOL Chemicals and more - CNBCTV18
summary:
Stocks to Watch on December 30: Key Movements in Reliance Infrastructure, JSW Energy, IOL Chemicals, and More

Publication Date: December 30, 2024 Source: CNBCTV18

This article highlights several stocks to watch on December 30, 2024, including significant developments in Reliance Infrastructure, JSW Energy, IOL Chemicals, and more.

  • Reliance Infrastructure: The company's unit received notices from Axis Bank and IDFC First Bank regarding alleged defaults on a concession agreement.
  • JSW Energy: Acquired O2 Power for ₹12,468 crore, increasing generation capacity by 23%.
  • IOL Chemicals: Announced a 1-for-5 stock split approved by its board.
  • Axis Max Life Insurance: Plans to discontinue operations of its pension fund management subsidiary.
  • Utkarsh Small Finance Bank: Will sell a portfolio of NPAs and written-off loans worth approximately ₹355 crore.
  • Hero MotoCorp: Extended partnership with Harley-Davidson for new motorcycle development.
“JSW Energy’s acquisition is its largest since inception, consolidating its position in the renewable energy sector.”

The developments in these companies indicate a significant trading day on December 30, with potential impacts on the market and stock performance.

title: In Azerbaijan, South Korea air crashes, survivors in planes’ tail end: what studies say on seating, survival rate - The Indian Express
summary:
Title: Azerbaijan & South Korea Air Crashes: Rear Seats Show Higher Survival Rate

Date & Source: December 29, 2022, from Indian Express (Source: Link)

Introduction: Two fatal air crashes within a week in Azerbaijan and South Korea have sparked discussions about seating and survival rates. Most survivors were found in the tail end of planes.

  1. On December 25, an Azerbaijan Airlines flight crashed near Aktau, Kazakhstan, with 38 fatalities out of 67 passengers.
  2. On December 29, a Jeju Air plane crashed during an emergency landing in South Korea, with 180 fatalities out of 181 passengers, making it the worst aviation disaster in South Korea's history.
The rear third of aircraft had a 32% fatality rate compared to 39% in the middle and 38% in the front (Time magazine, 2015 study).

Conclusion: While air travel remains statistically safe, studies suggest that the rear of the plane, particularly middle seats, may offer slightly better survival odds in crashes.
newTitle: Azerbaijan & South Korea Air Crashes: Rear Seats Show Higher Survival Rate

High employee attrition of 25% in private banks pose operational risk: RBI - Business Standard
summary:
High Employee Attrition Rates in Private Banks Pose Operational Risks, Says RBI

Publication Date: 2023-24 Source: Reserve Bank of India Report

Employee attrition in private sector banks has risen to 25%, creating significant operational risks according to the Reserve Bank of India's latest report.

  • Attrition rates are particularly high in private sector and small finance banks (SFBs).
  • Private banks have exceeded public sector banks in total employee numbers.
  • High turnover can disrupt customer services and lead to loss of institutional knowledge.
  • Strategies recommended for banks include improved onboarding, extensive training, and competitive benefits.
  • Regulators are advised to tighten guidelines on loan practices and monitoring of portfolios.
  • Climate change risks are highlighted as potential threats to financial stability and profitability.
“High attrition and employee turnover rate pose significant operational risks, including disruption in customer services...”

Overall, the RBI emphasizes that addressing employee attrition is a strategic imperative for banks to maintain stability and service quality.
newTitle: High Employee Attrition Rates in Private Banks Pose Operational Risks, Says RBI

title: High employee attrition of 25 per cent in private banks pose operational risk: RBI Report - The Times of India

  • This high turnover rate poses significant operational risks to banking institutions.
  • The RBI report calls for banks to address employee retention strategies effectively.

title: Stricter hand baggage rules for Air travel announced. One Bag, Max 7kg - India Today
summary:
Stricter Hand Baggage Rules for Air Travel Announced: One Bag, Max 7kg

Published On: Dec 29, 2024 | Source: Vaishnavi Parashar

The Bureau of Civil Aviation Security (BCAS) has announced new hand baggage regulations for air travellers, limiting each passenger to one cabin bag weighing up to 7 kg, effective next month. These changes aim to enhance security and streamline airport operations amid rising passenger numbers.

Key Points:

  • One bag limit: Passengers can carry only one handbag or cabin bag weighing no more than 7 kg.
  • Size restrictions: Maximum allowable size for cabin bags is 55 cm x 40 cm x 20 cm.
  • Extra fees for exceeding limits: Excess baggage fees will apply for bags that exceed size or weight limits.
  • Exemptions for pre-purchased tickets: Tickets issued before May 2, 2024, will follow the previous baggage policy.
  • Airlines updating policies: Airlines like IndiGo and Air India are aligning their baggage policies with the new guidelines.

Conclusion:

Travelers are encouraged to review the latest requirements to avoid surprises and ensure a smoother travel experience amid these changes.
newTitle: Stricter Hand Baggage Rules for Air Travel Announced: One Bag, Max 7kg

title: 2025 Personal Finance Updates: Key changes to know and plan ahead; visa, credit card, EPFO, fixed deposits, UPI, more | Mint - Mint
summary:
2025 Personal Finance Updates: Key changes to know and plan ahead

Publication Date: Not specified   Source: Live Mint

As we approach New Year 2025, it's crucial to realign financial goals by being aware of key changes involving fixed deposits, visa policies, credit cards, and more.

  • Thailand will launch an upgraded e-visa system accessible to broader regions.
  • In the US, new visa policy changes will require Indians to fill out a revised Form I-129 starting January 17, 2025.
  • The UK is raising the financial reserve requirements for visa applicants by 11% from January 2025.
  • New Fixed Deposit rules from the Reserve Bank of India will come into effect, allowing early withdrawals under certain conditions.
  • RuPay credit cardholders will have new criteria for airport lounge access.
  • EPFO will allow pension withdrawals from any bank branch starting January 1, 2025.
  • Unified Payments Interface (UPI) will be enabled for Full-KYC Prepaid Payment Instruments.
"Being unaware of these personal financial changes may lead to missing key deadlines or deprive you of benefits of significant schemes."

In conclusion, staying updated with these changes is essential for effectively managing personal finances in 2025.
newTitle: Key Personal Finance Changes to Prepare for in 2025

title: 'Why can't people own the dollars' Deepak Shenoy debates RBI restriction on mutual funds investing in foreign stocks | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Why can’t people own the dollars? Deepak Shenoy debates RBI restriction on mutual funds investing in foreign stocks

Date: December 29, 2024

Source: Live Mint

Deepak Shenoy advocates for an increase in the limit for mutual funds investing in foreign stocks, proposing a raise from the current $8 billion to $50 billion, arguing the existing limit has been unchanged since 2009.

  • Shenoy highlights the disparity between mutual fund limits and individual investment allowances.
  • He questions why Indian mutual funds can't invest more in foreign stocks when individual investors can invest significantly more through foreign brokers.
  • Calls for a reevaluation of the RBI's stance on ownership of foreign assets, suggesting that individuals should have more access to invest through mutual funds.
“Why do we still have restrictions on Indian mutual funds investing in foreign stocks, when we can do the same thing as individuals?” – Deepak Shenoy
newTitle: Deepak Shenoy Challenges RBI on Mutual Fund Restrictions for Foreign Stocks

title: Country's liquor companies may approach FSSAI for separate standard for Indian single malt whisky - The Economic Times
summary:
Country's liquor companies may approach FSSAI for separate standard for Indian single malt whisky

Date: [Insert Publication Date] Source: [Insert Source]

Homegrown Indian liquor makers are considering approaching the FSSAI for a separate standard for Indian single malt whisky, which has gained popularity and won international awards. This is aimed at maintaining the reputation of Indian single malt exports.

  • Indian distillers want a geographical indication tag for their single malt whisky.
  • Indian single malt whisky sales are rising significantly, facing competition from smaller brands.
  • Current FSSAI definitions inadequately cover single malt standards.
  • Concerns over misrepresentation of Indian single malt by some producers.
  • Growth in the single malt segment attributed to increasing consumer preferences and favorable climate conditions.
“We believe that FSSAI should amend its regulations to include a separate standard applicable to Indian single malt whisky.” — Anant S Iyer, CIABC Director General

The call for a separate standard highlights the need for credibility in the Indian whisky market, which is increasingly competing on a global scale.
newTitle: Indian Liquor Companies Seek Separate Standard for Single Malt Whisky

title: Adani Enterprises revenue to jump to Rs 1.5 trn, earnings to rise 46% - Business Standard
summary:
Adani Enterprises Revenue to Reach ₹1.5 Trillion with 46% Earnings Growth

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Financial Report

Adani Enterprises Ltd (AEL) is projected to see its consolidated revenue soar to ₹1.5 trillion, with net earnings expected to grow by 46% in the fiscal years 2024 to 2027, as outlined in a recent report by Ventura Securities.

The company continues to diversify into green hydrogen, sustaining robust fundamentals despite previous stock volatility due to external allegations.

  • Projected revenue growth at a CAGR of 17.5% from FY24 to FY27.
  • Net earnings expected to increase by 45.8%, reaching ₹9,245 crore.
  • Strategic intervention under the National Green Hydrogen Mission with a significant funding outlay.
  • Successful fundraising initiatives, including ₹4,200 crore through Qualified Institutional Placement (QIP).
  • Improvements in profit margins and return ratios expected from ongoing projects.
"Strong growth in airports and solar/wind turbine businesses and revenue contribution from copper are expected to enhance financial performance and profit margins."

The anticipated growth and strategic expansions highlight AEL's critical role in India's economic landscape as it ventures into new markets and technology.
newTitle: Adani Enterprises Revenue to Reach ₹1.5 Trillion with 46% Earnings Growth

title: Housing supply up 44 pc in NCR this year to 53K units; luxury home share in launches 60 pc: Anarock | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Housing supply up 44 pc in NCR this year to 53K units; luxury home share in launches 60 pc: Anarock

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Anarock

This year, the Delhi-NCR housing market experienced a remarkable 44% growth in new housing supply, amounting to 53,000 units, with a substantial share being ultra-luxury homes.

  • The number of new residential property launches totaled 36,735 units in 2023.
  • Ultra-luxury homes, priced above ₹2.5 crore, constituted nearly 60% of the new supply.
  • Sales in the Delhi-NCR market declined by 6% to 61,900 units compared to the previous year.
  • Overall housing launches in seven major Indian cities saw a 7% decrease.
  • The total sales across these seven cities also saw a marginal decline of 4% this year.
  • Anarock's Chairman noted that elections and slowed project approvals affected new housing supply.
Anarock Chairman Anuj Puri stated, "2024 has been a mixed bag for the Indian housing sector... sales also saw a marginal decline... offset by a 16 percent jump in the overall sales value."

In conclusion, despite the challenges posed by the economic environment, the luxury segment remains resilient, indicating a shift in consumer preferences in the housing market.
newTitle: Housing Supply Sees 44% Increase in NCR This Year, Luxury Homes Dominate

title: ITC Demerger Record Date: Will buying stock on Jan 6, 2025 make you eligible for ITC Hotels shares? - ET Now
summary:
ITC Demerger Record Date: Will buying stock on Jan 6, 2025 make you eligible for ITC Hotels shares?

Updated: December 29, 2024 13:15 IST Source: ET Now News

ITC's proposed hotels business demerger will become effective from January 2025, with January 6, 2025 set as the record date for eligibility of shareholders.

  • ITC's proposed hotels business demerger will come into effect from January 2025.
  • The record date for determining eligibility is January 6, 2025.
  • Shareholders will receive equity shares of ITC Hotels based on this record date.
Eligible shareholders will receive one share of ITC Hotels for every 10 shares they hold in ITC.

The ITC Hotels demerger is significant as it represents a strategic split in the company's business, aimed at enhancing shareholder value.
newTitle: ITC Demerger Record Date: Key Details for Shareholders
